intro: Henriettea macfadyenii, commonly known as the Macfadyen's heath, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late summer. Henriettea macfadyenii thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires a cool, moist climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
